result.execSummary:
The defendant Vernon Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 7/15/2017.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

Restitution set at zero.
Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program and a parenting program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vernon Anderson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vernon Anderson not in court.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from DOC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC, Criminal Complaint, and Court Record sent to Valeria Taylor, Attorney at Law (State Public Defender - 819 N 6th St.).
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of SENTENCING HEARING Proceedings commencing JULY 15, 2014  (22 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.  Copy provided to:  Institution.

Defendant Vernon Anderson in court with attorney Awni M. Yasin.  Defendant Vernon Anderson in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 106 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/15/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/15/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Vernon Anderson in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Vernon Anderson in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 7/15/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Vernon Anderson not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Yasin phoned the court to ask for an adjourned final pre-trial due to a family emergency.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Vernon Anderson not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 5/22/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 6/16/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #06JV1018B that are attached to the complaint.   Sworn for the state:Karl Wallich-MPD Officer.      State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.

Defendant Vernon Anderson in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Vernon Anderson in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 hour curfew) and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Vernon Anderson in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Vernon Anderson in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defense moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss and takes judicial notice of the year 2006 as the year of Defendant's juvenile felony and the swearing of the complaint as to the juvenile record.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
